sentence.Network_en: The system has proved fallible time after time.
sentence.Network_cn: 时间一次又一次证明，这个系统是会出错的。
记忆有选择性而且会出错。

sentence.Network_en: We're fallible , so we make mistakes.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... fallacious a 犯错误的 fallible a 易错的 infallible a 无可指责的.
SAT官方发布高频词汇汇总_百度文库 ... anthropological： 人类学的 fallible： 易犯错误的 fallacy： 谬论.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... fungible 可替代的 fallible 会犯错的，易犯错的 gullible 易受骗的.

list.abs: pleasure is by means an infallible critical guide , but it is the least fallible .愉悦不是一贯正确的批评标准，但它却是最保险的。
Efficient market theory is highly fallible , but it may still be better than anything else ., 有效市场理论高度易错 , 但是比别的也许仍然好.
analysis on the fallibility point of conic圆锥曲线易错点分析
analysis on fallible problems in electric fire - extinguishing system design ., 电气消防系统设计易错问题剖析.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin fallibilis, from Latin fallere 'deceive'

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is fallible, you mean that they are not perfect and are likely to make mistakes or to fail in what they are doing.

example.ex: They are only human and all too fallible...
example.tran: 他们只不过是普通人，太容易犯错误了。

example.ex: The system has proved fallible time after time...
example.tran: 时间一次又一次证明,这个系统是会出错的。

means.word_mean: 1. likely to fail or be inaccurate;
2. having the attributes of man as opposed to e.g. divine beings;

auth_sentence.content: These men were exhausted, lonesome, and fallible.
auth_sentence.res_content: These men were exhausted, lonesome, and fallible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These men were exhausted, lonesome, and fallible.

auth_sentence.content: Dogma may well be considered fallible but they do change.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dogma may well be considered fallible but they do change.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dogma may well be considered fallible but they do change.

auth_sentence.content: Memories are fallible, especially of traumatic times.
auth_sentence.res_content: Memories are fallible, especially of traumatic times.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Memories are fallible, especially of traumatic times.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =err/deceive,表示"犯错误,欺骗"; 2. = 表示"错,假"

stems_affixes.word_buile: fall犯错误,欺骗+acious有……特征的→有错误的
fall犯错误,欺骗+ible能……的→能犯错的→会犯错的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 绝不会错的,绝对不可靠的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+fallible[adj.会犯错的,易犯错的]→adj.绝不会错的,绝对不可靠的
fall犯错误,欺骗+acy性质,状态→n.谬误,错误

sentences.en: We’re fallible, so we make mistakes.
